sefAima.title: Understanding SEF/AIMA Reporting Obligations
sefAima.subtitle: Legal Requirements for Short-Term Rentals in Portugal
sefAima.description: Operating a short-term rental in Portugal entails specific legal obligations, notably the requirement to report guest information to the Portuguese Immigration and Borders Service. As of October 29, 2023, the responsibilities previously held by SEF (Serviço de Estrangeiros e Fronteiras) have been transferred to AIMA (Agência para a Imigração e Mobilidade), the new agency overseeing immigration and mobility matters. This reporting is conducted through the SIBA (Sistema de Informação de Boletins de Alojamento) platform.

legalCompliance.title: Legal Compliance
legalCompliance.mandatory: Mandatory Requirement: All accommodation providers must collect and report specific information about foreign guests to AIMA within three working days of their arrival.
legalCompliance.security: National Security: Assists in monitoring foreign nationals, contributing to national security and immigration control.
legalCompliance.transparency: Transparency: Helps prevent illegal activities such as human trafficking and visa overstays.

complexity.understanding: Understanding Requirements: The process involves legal nuances and timely submissions.
complexity.hesitation: Guest Hesitation: Guests may be reluctant to share personal information.

refusal.title: Legal Obligation to Refuse Accommodation
refusal.description: Under Portuguese law (Articles 15 and 16 of Law No. 23/2007 of 4 July), you must refuse accommodation if a guest declines to provide the required information.

support.title: Our Support
support.compliance: Ensuring Compliance: We manage data collection to minimize such situations.

financial.title: Financial Penalties
financial.individuals: Individuals: Fines ranging from €100 to €5,000 per infraction.
financial.corporations: Corporations: Fines from €2,000 to €10,000 per infraction.

legal.title: Legal Consequences
legal.criminal: Criminal Charges: Possible for deliberate or repeated violations.
legal.imprisonment: Imprisonment: Sentences ranging from one to five years in severe cases.
legal.restrictions: Operational Restrictions: Potential suspension or revocation of your rental license.

condominium.title: Impact on Condominium Properties
condominium.intervention: Condominium Intervention: Non-compliance may lead to efforts by the condominium association to shut down your rental operation.
condominium.grounds: Legal Grounds: Other owners might challenge your rental activities based on legal violations.

touristTax.title: Tourist Tax Collection
touristTax.description: In addition to SEF/AIMA reporting, short-term rental operators in Portugal are required to collect Municipal Tourist Taxes (Taxa Municipal Turística) from guests, where applicable.

support.title: Our Support
support.calculation: Automated Calculation: We calculate the appropriate tax based on your property's location and applicable rates.
support.collection: Transparent Collection: We communicate the tax clearly to guests during the booking process.
support.remittance: Timely Remittance: We ensure that collected taxes are remitted to the appropriate municipal authorities on schedule.

conclusion.title: Conclusion
conclusion.description: Compliance with SEF/AIMA reporting and tourist tax obligations is essential for your rental business's success and legal standing in Portugal. SmartHoster takes the complexity out of this process, allowing you to focus on providing excellent hospitality while we handle the legal obligations.
